revised_title: Investigating the Nature and Evolution of Atmospherics
tldr: This article investigates the nature and evolution of atmospherics, focusing on the rapid changes of the Earth's electric field associated with lightning flashes. The authors use a combination of a Wilson sphere and an electrometer triode to study the changes in the electric field and analyze the wave-forms of atmospherics. They find that the high-frequency components of atmospherics travel with a higher group velocity than the low-frequency components, and that the ratio of the radiation field to the electrostatic field increases with distance.
